Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jintaa> In line with the recent rumblings of more awareness for our great little project that could, and the community's efforts to that end, I have  a question about veruscoin.io. Has there been any discussion about updating/upgrading it? It is the first destination most people will go to learn about our project, and the biggest aggregated source of more data and knowledge on the project- it directs people to the code, whitepaper and vision paper, the wallet, all social media, etc. Being the main landing point for all newcomers, I was wondering if others thought it needs more? I know it's not a priority, compared to the actual work of building the whole point of the website itself, but is it considered important enough by the team and community to get a facelift and upgrade?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ABK> I have a little side bit of Verus that I want to keep safe for a rainy day, is there any material risk in keeping this balance in a wallet that I have the pass phrase for, but nothing else (no wallet.dat)...? Seems a coldish type option?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @ABK as long as the passphrase is sufficiently strong and you really can't lose/forget it, it should be fine. if anything happens to your memory, of course, then it's gone.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ABK> @miketout it‚Äôs the seed phrase that generates the private keys in the wallet, guessing this would be secure? Yes major risk is then losing the paper it‚Äôs written on...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <ABK> @miketout congrats on this project too, it‚Äôs shaping up amazingly well

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @ABK thank you! As I said, it‚Äôs a community effort, and I think this is just the beginning. Maybe I misunderstand your question. You cannot reconstruct the whole wallet from just the HD seed in the wallet. There is a way to generate the Sapling addresses, but only the Sapling addresses are HD. I would recommend either keeping your funds in one address, for which you have the private key, or backing up your wallet or wallet dump file (see z_expoerwallet).
